alert.note: Alert for Northern Franklin; Northern St. Lawrence; Southwestern St. Lawrence (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 11 at 3:25AM EST until March 13 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 1 AM EST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 9 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph, mainly Saturday afternoon and night. * WHERE...Northern St. Lawrence, Northern Franklin and Southwestern St. Lawrence Counties. * WHEN...From 4 PM this afternoon to 1 AM EST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Light snow will begin overspread the region this evening. We will see snow taper off Saturday evening and come to an Saturday night. Gusty northwest winds between 25 and 35 mph will develop Saturday afternoon and continue into the overnight hours. Blowing snow may develop and significantly reduce visibility across the region.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Please allow extra time if travel is necessary.

area.areaDesc: Northern Franklin; Northern St. Lawrence; Southwestern St. Lawrence
